Security policy management
Security policy is a set of rules aimed at improving the data security. We pay special attention to this part of information security. In GreenData, users are given the opportunity to configure and manage their own security policy.
Creating a security policy
To create a security policy for an application, go to: Administration → Access control → Security policy management:
2. The "Security Policy" registry [SYS_PASSWORD_POLICY] will open. The object can be found via "Administration" → "Object Management"→ "Object Types". Where a new instance of the object can be created by clicking
on the control panel.
3. In a new window, specify the name and set the security policy by using switch buttons:

Only one security policy can be active in the application. By trying to save another security policy with this property, the system will notify that an already active security policy already exists and will offer to replace it.

Block users in the absence of entrances to the system
Activation of the user account lockout property if there is no login during the specified time.
Permissible period of absence in the system, days
Number of days when the user is not authorized, after which the account will be blocked.
Day count starts from the date of the last authorization, if the user has never passed the authorization process, then the date of the last activity is considered to be the date of the user’s data change.
By default, the field is set to 5 days.
The field is displayed when the "Block users in the absence of entrances to the system.
Password authentication settings
These settings
do not apply
to users logging in via
domain login
or using the OAuth 2 protocol.
Set the frequency of the mandatory password change
Setting up frequency of the mandatory password change option.
Password validity period, days
Number of days of password validity after which this password will be invalid and will need to be replaced.
Day count starts from the last date of password change, in its absence from the date when the security policy activity sign is enabled.
By default, the field is set to 90 days.
The field is displayed when the "Set the frequency of mandatory password change" option is active.
Block account with unsuccessful entry attempts
Activation of the user account lockout property in case of unsuccessful password entry attempts.
Number of acceptable unsuccessful attempts
Number of attempts to enter an incorrect password, after which the user will be blocked.
By default, the field takes the value 3.
The field is displayed when the "Block account in case of unsuccessful input attempts" option is active.
Password input mask
Defining a set of rules governing the acceptable format of the user’s password.
The password input mask is defined by the "User password input mask" type  [SYS_PASSWORD_MASK].
The previously created configuration objects are selected from the drop-down list, adding a new setting is available through the parameter actions menu.
There are 3 password difficulty levels pre-configured in the System:
minimum difficulty;
at least 8 characters;
contains numbers;
contains lowercase and uppercase letters;
does not contain visually ambiguous characters.
average difficulty;
at least 11 characters;
contains numbers;
contains lowercase and uppercase letters;
contains special characters;
does not contain visually ambiguous characters.
maximum difficulty.
at least 14 characters;
contains numbers;
contains lowercase and uppercase letters;
contains special characters;
does not contain 3 or more repeated or consecutive characters.
By default, the password input mask is set to "Current settings", which includes password settings previously used in the System: at least 8 characters, contains numbers, lowercase and uppercase letters, as well as special characters.
When selecting a password entry mask, the corresponding
settings
will be displayed at the bottom of the screen.
Number of passwords banned for reuse
Determining the number of previously used user passwords that cannot be used.
Reset passwords for all users of the System.
When clicking on the button, a corresponding warning will be displayed, in the window of which  the "Yes" button to reset all user passwords should be clicked.
The
button is only available for an active password policy.
Password input mask
Defining a set of rules regulating the allowed format of the user password.
The password input mask is defined by the "User password input mask" type [SYS_PASSWORD_MASK].
Previously created configuration objects can be selected from the drop-down list. Adding a new configuration is available via the parameter action menu.
The System provides 3 predefined password complexity levels:
minimum complexity;
at least 8 characters;
contains digits;
contains both lowercase and uppercase letters;
does not contain visually ambiguous characters.
medium complexity;
at least 11 characters;
contains digits;
contains both lowercase and uppercase letters;
contains special characters;
does not contain visually ambiguous characters.
maximum complexity.
at least 14 characters;
contains digits;
contains both lowercase and uppercase letters;
contains special characters;
does not contain 3 or more repeating or sequential characters.
By default, the password input mask is set to "Current settings", which includes previously used System password configuration parameters: at least 8 characters, contains digits, lowercase and uppercase letters, as well as special characters.
When a password input mask is selected, the corresponding settings will be displayed at the bottom of the screen.
Reseting passwords for all System users.
When the button is clicked, a confirmation dialog will appear. Click "Yes" to reset all user passwords.
The button is available only for the active password policy.
Number of passwords banned for reuse
Defining the number of previously used passwords that cannot be reused.
By default, this parameter is set to 1.
Lock duration
Defining the duration of the user account lock after failed password attempts. Once the specified time elapses, the account will be automatically unlocked.
To configure the lock duration, the user must specify the unit of measurement in the corresponding field.
If a lock duration is set, the user will see a message indicating the unlock date and time when attempting to log in.
Example
If no lock duration is set, the user will remain locked until an administrator manually removes the lock in the
user password credentials settings
.
Example
By default, the lock duration is 30 minutes.
Unit of measurement
Defining the unit of measurement for the lock duration. Possible options:
Second;
Minute;
Hour;
Day.

Setting up a password mask
Setting up a password input mask involves defining the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Password length
Determining the minimum password length.
By default, the minimum password length should be 8 characters.
Include numbers
Required to use numbers in the password.
If the parameter is active, the password must contain at least one digit.
The parameter is active by default.
Include lowercase characters
Required to use lowercase letters in the password.
If the parameter is active, the password must contain at least one lowercase letter.
The parameter is active by default.
Include uppercase characters
Required to use uppercase letters in the password.
If the parameter is active, the password must contain at least one uppercase letter.
The parameter is active by default.
Exclude visually ambiguous characters
The use of visually ambiguous characters in the password is prohibited:
i, I, 1, l, o, 0, O
.
If the parameter is active, the use of the specified characters in the password is not allowed.
The parameter is inactive by default.
Include special characters
Required to use special characters in the password.
When the parameter is active, the password must contain at least one special character.
The parameter is active by default.
Exclude passwords consisting of repeated or consecutive characters
Prohibiting the use of passwords consisting of repeated or consecutive characters.
When the option is active, the use of 3 or more repeated or consecutive characters in the password is not allowed.
The parameter is inactive by default.
Applying security policy
The default security policy applies to
system users
logging into the application with a password.
For particular security principals with a
privilege level
, the default security policy can be overridden.
If a user belongs to different access groups corresponding to different privilege levels, they will retain the highest available priority.
In the "Password authentication" account profile, the system records user activity data, such as:
password change date;
last login date;
number of incorrect password entries.
